name: Serena Semantic Code Analysis MCP Server

envSchema.name: SERENA_PROJECT_PATH
envSchema.description: Path to the project directory for semantic code analysis

healthCheck.command: echo 'Serena MCP server configured for project'

project: Find and understand MCP server implementations
Navigate code relationships in the project
Perform semantic searches for specific patterns

pros: PRIMARY TOOL for code navigation - use instead of Read/Grep
cons: Requires Python and uv package manager
Initial indexing can take time for large projects

primaryUse: ALL code navigation in this project
preferOverNative: ALWAYS use instead of Read for code exploration
ALWAYS use instead of Grep for code search
Use get_symbols_overview before reading entire files
fallbackToNative: Use Read for non-code files (JSON, MD, etc)
Use Grep for simple string searches in configs
Use Read for final verification after edits
toolSelectionProtocol.efficiency: Serena is MORE efficient than Read/Grep for code - reads only necessary symbols, not entire files

ratingRationale.human: High - Provides semantic understanding that humans can verify. Shows exact symbol locations and relationships, making code review more efficient. Helps humans understand AI's navigation decisions.
ratingRationale.agent: Essential - Primary tool for code understanding and navigation. Enables semantic edits and refactoring with precision. Dramatically reduces token usage by reading only necessary symbols instead of entire files.

bestPractices: ALWAYS use instead of Read/Grep for code exploration
Use get_symbols_overview first to understand file structure
Use find_symbol for precise navigation to specific functions/classes
Combine with memory to track codebase understanding
agenticUsefulness.humanRole: Verify semantic understanding and validate refactoring decisions
agenticUsefulness.agentRole: PRIMARY code navigation and understanding tool - replaces traditional file reading
integrationSynergies: Sequential Thinking to plan refactoring strategies
Context7 to understand framework patterns before editing
